item.title: Mannyverse Puzzle
The Mannyverse: A 3D Web3gl Game
item.description: Welcome to the Mannyverse. https://kintisbo.itch.io/mannyverse The Mannyverse is a custom world I built for a popular 3D NFT called Mannys.game. Mannys.game: An Intro Manny is a person. Manny is also a collection of non-fungible digital clones of Manny. The original NFT Manny created was released as a psycological game. He used a 3d body scan of himself as the token, modifying a select number to have a special characterstic (Zombie Manny, Inverted Manny, Silver Manny, etc.

item.title: Threekly 2: It Continues...
Threekly 1: The first Threekly!
item.description: And thus begins my first weekly. A major point of this is exercise is to keep engaged and up to date with both current events and current media. I often find myself wishing I had kept more up-to-date with certain happenings, and this is my chance to mitigate any of that in the future. With that being said, let’s dive in to this week’s Threekly: 1. A thought problem I’ve been consumed with: Russell’s Paradox This video does a great job explaining it, but in short, it deals with Set Theory.

item.title: One Token vs. Many Token
item.description: Both One Token and Many Token are under development and will be released soon! Stay tuned!

item.title: Takeaways From Learning Ethereum
item.description: Over the past few months, I have done a deep dive in to Solidity and Ethereum development. This has included some Web3, but the main focus has been on Solidity and ERC standards. Below is a short list of resources I used, as well as some brief takeaways. Resources I Used Nader Dabit. I cannot stress enough how phenomenal that guy is at teaching. Tutorials https://cryptozombies.

item.title: The Function of Supply: An ERC-20 Experiment in Minimum Transactable Value
item.description: An Experiment in the Supply of ERC-20 Tokens This is still a work in progress Abstract This “greypaper” serves to identify a little discussed issue. Popular tokens like Ethereum and Bitcoin, as they gain popularity, inch closer to a divisibility bomb in what I’ve dubbed “the Satoshi problem.” High market cap coins with limited supply and fixed divisibility will eventually experience a slowdown in the network when users are unable to micro-transact.

item.title: First Post
item.description: This is my first post. It is a test post. It is a good post. It is not a fence post.

item.title: Past Project Spotlight #1: Flying Blind, a heart-beat sensing game
item.description: Code Design The purpose of this prototype was to incorporate controls that extended beyond the traditional human-computer interaction in game design. To achieve this, I chose to use off-the-shelf hardware to track a user’s heartbeat, which in turn controls the ship they are on. Software The game polls the heart rate monitor at a rate of 3 hz. At game start, I “calibrate” the sensor by taking the heart rate and computing a moving average across a range of 30 seconds.

item.title: About
item.description: Spencer Obsitnik (born Speezy F Baby, November 17, 1995) is an Oscar nominated child of four. After inventing Facebook and winning “Least Likely to Hyperbolize” in a grade school he did not attend, he rode 1000 miles on camelback to diffuse forgotten landmines. An Ashkenazi Jew by trade, and an Olympic surfer by birthright, he now lays dormant on his vast collections of oxford commas, beanie babies, and Cheerio’s Year 2000 pennies, where he wishes to be disturbed only by the Obamas.
